content.detail:
We migrated the former version of the El Capitan Theatre site to our proprietary CMS platform, becoming the only ecommerce website housed on our platform.

As the Platform Product Manager, I managed the data ingestion needed in order for the CMS to be able to refer to the most current and accurate film screening data.

I was also a consultant in helping with the Frontend side of the project since it involved two aspects:

  1. Redesigning site's branding and theming with a new theme that hadn't been supported by our platform before
  2. The Frontend code was also referring to a new Frontend framework, different from the framework I previously worked in as a frontend developer on the team. So I helped in deciding new data structure, content types, and additional tools needed to build out customizable pages that adhere to a style theme branded for the theatre.

As the Product Operations side of my team, I onboarded the Theatre's site producers onto the platform, assisted them as they learned to build pages on the site, and shepherded the individual launches of each website. I also ensured that the site was set up with proper redirects from the old version of the site and was localized per region based on available CMS tools.

images.alt: Homepage of multiple film screening options to experience at the theatre
Webpage dedicated to providing theatre directions and contact information
